Poisson's kernel for the half-space and unit ball

Detailed derivations of the Possion's kernel in the upper half-space and the unit ball

Published

03 November 2018

Let Ω\OmegaΩ be an open, bounded subset of Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn with C2\mathrm{C}^2C2 boundary. We recall that, if we assume a solution u∈C2(Ω‾)u\in \mathrm{C}^2(\overline{\Omega})u∈C2(Ω) exists for

{−Δu=0in  Ω,u=gon  ∂Ω(1) \begin{cases} \begin{aligned} -\Delta u &= 0 & &\qquad\text{in}\;\Omega,\\ u &= g & &\qquad\text{on}\;\partial\Omega \end{aligned} \end{cases} \tag{1} {−Δuu​=0=g​​inΩ,on∂Ω​​(1)

then for every x∈Ωx\in \Omegax∈Ω, if we solve for ϕx(⋅)\phi^x(\cdot)ϕx(⋅) the solution to

{−Δϕx(y)=0y∈Ω,ϕx(y)=Φ(x−y)y∈∂Ω(2) \begin{cases} \begin{aligned} -\Delta \phi^x(y) &= 0 & &\qquad y\in \Omega,\\ \phi^x(y) &= \Phi(x-y) & &\qquad y\in \partial\Omega \end{aligned} \end{cases} \tag{2} {−Δϕx(y)ϕx(y)​=0=Φ(x−y)​​y∈Ω,y∈∂Ω​​(2)

where Φ(x)\Phi(x)Φ(x) is the fundamental solution to the Laplace equation −ΔΦ=δ0-\Delta \Phi = \delta_0−ΔΦ=δ0​ in Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn. Then the Green function is given by G(x,y)=Φ(y−x)−ϕx(y)G(x,y) = \Phi(y-x) - \phi^x(y)G(x,y)=Φ(y−x)−ϕx(y).

If we assume u∈C2(Ω‾)u\in \mathrm{C}^2(\overline{\Omega})u∈C2(Ω) then all the derivations are rigorous, therefore we have the following theorem.

If Ω\OmegaΩ is an open, bounded subset with C2\mathrm{C}^2C2 boundary and u∈C2(Ω‾)u\in\mathrm{C}^2(\overline{\Omega})u∈C2(Ω) then u(x)=−∫∂Ωg(y)∂yG(x,y)∂νdS(y),x∈Ω u(x) = -\int_{\partial \Omega} g(y)\frac{\partial_yG(x,y)}{\partial\nu} dS(y), \qquad x\in \Omega u(x)=−∫∂Ω​g(y)∂ν∂y​G(x,y)​dS(y),x∈Ω where ν\nuν is the unit outward normal vector on the boundary ∂Ω\partial \Omega∂Ω.
